column4: why can't I execute a file? ./crclient -u gives --> bash: ./crclient: No such file or directory
See that the executable bit is set for it.
file crclient      #See what it really is.
crclient: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked (uses shared libs), for GNU/Linux 2.2.5, stripped
where did you get it?   (It appears to have an error.)
let me download and try again
downloaded from a different source too
Do you have a swap partition?  sudo fdisk -l
Having a swap partition is best.
But if you really want to use a swap file.... you can...
